edu.albany.cci.nlpg.ConText

Class ConText

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.albany.cci.nlpg.ConText.ConText

  • public class ConText
extends java.lang.Object

    ConText Algorithm Implemented in Java

    Usage: Call the getConText function with the below information.

    • Provide a sentence to determine the context of.
    • Create an ArrayList of trigger terms to locate and annotate in the sentence. Each list item should be formatted as follows, tab-separated:

      trigger-term    [TAG]

      Note: Trigger terms may be in the form of regular expressions. This is useful for a variety of time related trigger terms.

      The following tags are available:

      • [PSEU] - Pseudo negation trigger
      • [PREN] - Pre-negation trigger
      • [PREP] - Possible pre-negation trigger
      • [POST] - Post-negation trigger
      • [POSP] - Possible post-negation trigger
      • [EXPO] - Other experiencer trigger
      • [HYPT] - Hypothetical temporality trigger
      • [HYPS] - Pseudo hypothetical temporality trigger
      • [HIST] - Historical temporality trigger
      • [HISP] - Pseudo historical temporality trigger
      • [TERM] - Termination trigger (end scope)
    • Optional: Create an ArrayList of phrases to locate and annotate in the sentence. Each line should contain a single phrase to search the sentence for.

    ConText/NegEx algorithm from Wendy Chapman

    Based on NegEx implementation by Imre Solti

    Author:
    Ken Burford, Imre Solti (sortTerms function)

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean DISABLE_SCOPE_EXCEPTIONS
      By default, getConText will apply exceptions to scope for certain trigger terms.
      boolean DISABLE_SORT
      Set to true to stop getConText from sorting the list of triggers and phrases on every call.
      boolean FIX_PHRASE_TAGS
      By default, getConText will attempt to correct incorrect phrase tags, such as [PHRASE=APR]some disease[PHRASE], and fill the whitespace with a filler character.
      boolean VERBOSE_MODE
      By default, the post-processor will not leave trigger tags in a sentence.

      java.lang.String getConText(java.lang.String sentence, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> triggers, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> phrases)
      Annotates a sentence based on specified phrases and trigger terms and runs it through Wendy Chapman's ConText algorithm.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sortTerms(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> unsortedTerms)
      Takes a list of unsorted terms and organizes them by length in descending order, so that longer terms will be matched first.

    • Field Detail

      • DISABLE_SORT

        public boolean DISABLE_SORT
        Set to true to stop getConText from sorting the list of triggers and phrases on every call.

        The trigger and phrase lists must be sorted ahead of time by calling the sortTerms function first, or incorrect results will be returned.

      • FIX_PHRASE_TAGS

        public boolean FIX_PHRASE_TAGS
        By default, getConText will attempt to correct incorrect phrase tags, such as [PHRASE=APR]some disease[PHRASE], and fill the whitespace with a filler character. Set to false to disable this.

        If the phrases already have the proper filler characters, leaving this enabled will not hurt input, and it will be properly stripped before output as expected.

      • DISABLE_SCOPE_EXCEPTIONS

        public boolean DISABLE_SCOPE_EXCEPTIONS
        By default, getConText will apply exceptions to scope for certain trigger terms. Set this to true to disable these exceptions.

        Example: the trigger "previous" has a hard coded scope of one token.

      • VERBOSE_MODE

        public boolean VERBOSE_MODE
        By default, the post-processor will not leave trigger tags in a sentence. Set this variable to true to switch to verbose mode, which will leave trigger tags.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConText

        public ConText()

    • Method Detail

      • getConText

        public java.lang.String getConText(java.lang.String sentence,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> triggers,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> phrases)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Annotates a sentence based on specified phrases and trigger terms and runs it through Wendy Chapman's ConText algorithm.

        The resulting sentence has all trigger terms properly annotated and the specified phrases flagged to indicate their predicted context.

        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to annotate
        phrase - the phrase to determine the context of
        triggers - the list of trigger terms and bracketed identifiers
        Returns:
        the sentence will triggers annotated and context flags set
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getConText

        public java.lang.String getConText(java.lang.String sentence,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> triggers)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sortTerms

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sortTerms(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> unsortedTerms)
        Takes a list of unsorted terms and organizes them by length in descending order, so that longer terms will be matched first.
        Parameters:
        unsortedTerms - an unsorted list of terms to reorder
        Returns:
        the original list of terms organized by length, descending
